title: When Do Nitrate Levels Spike?
text:
Nitrate supports aquatic life at natural levels but in excess drives algal blooms and hypoxia. Managers need a quick way to know when nitrate spikes and whether routine sensors (conductivity, turbidity, dissolved oxygen, temperature, stage) can stand in for expensive nitrate probes.
This post recasts my Assignment 2 analysis into an accessible summary: one clear figure, one compact table, and a practical takeaway.

title: GIRIKA
text:
Hi, I’m Girika — a Master of Business Analytics student at Monash University.
I translate technical analyses into clear stories using R, Quarto, Excel and the tidyverse. This site turns my
Assignment 2 nitrate analysis into an accessible blog post for broader audiences.
Interests: communicating with data, uncertainty, reproducibility,visualisation
Tools: R, Quarto,Excel, GitHub
Workflow: version control, literate programming, clean figure/table design with captions & cross-references
Part-time Associate: Support prospective students with application preparation and documentation, maintain accurate CRM records, and also coordinate timelines between students, institutions, and internal teams. Contribute to data-driven insights for process improvements.

title: When Do Nitrate Levels Spike?
text:
Nitrate supports aquatic life at natural levels but in excess drives algal blooms and hypoxia. Managers need a quick way to know when nitrate spikes and whether routine sensors (conductivity, turbidity, dissolved oxygen, temperature, stage) can stand in for expensive nitrate probes.
This post recasts my Assignment 2 analysis into an accessible summary: one clear figure, one compact table, and a practical takeaway.

title: When Do Nitrate Levels Spike?
text:
Analysis
Data source. NEON river sites — Arikaree (CO), Caribou (AK), Lewis Run (VA); nitrate by SUNA V2 (~15-min), with routine sensors at similar cadence.
Approach In A2 I fitted GAMMs linking nitrate to routine sensors and time structure. For the blog: one clear figure + one table and what they mean.








Figure 1: Nitrate contrasts by site (median, µM).





Reading Figure Figure 1. Lewis Run’s median nitrate dwarfs the others; Caribou is low and steady; Arikaree is lower on median but more event-driven. This points to where risk is persistent and when to prioritise targeted sampling (e.g., post-rain windows).




Table 1: Compact summary of site medians (µM), days measured, and share of total.

Reading Table Table 1. The numbers mirror Figure Figure 1 and support a targeted monitoring plan: keep routine sensors everywhere; add nitrate-specific effort at higher-risk sites/times.
Why routine sensors matter (A2). In my Assignment 2 models, a small, consistent set of routine variables captured most of the signal for nitrate; once temporal structure is included, fit was extremely high. That means managers can rely on calibrated routine sensors as a cost-effective backbone, using nitrate probes for calibration and hotspots.

title: When Do Nitrate Levels Spike?
text:
Conclusion
Short, event-driven nitrate episodes drive most risk. Use routine sensors everywhere, calibrate locally, and concentrate extra effort around likely peak windows. This communication-first summary complements the technical A2 report and aligns with literature showing nitrate can be inferred from routine variables across contrasting rivers (Kermorvant et al. 2023).
bibliography: references.bib(Kermorvant et al. 2023)
